author: mschachter
msg: - If "type" and/or "name" attributes aren't specified, the form tag
searches through the ActionMappings to find a mapping that corresponds
to the "action" attribute to retrieve the "name" and "type" values

author: mschachter
msg: - the "name" and "type" attributes for the form tag are no
longer required due to the upcoming change in FormTag.java

author: craigmcc
msg: Change the "rtexprvalue" setting on a bunch of attributes to "true".

author: craigmcc
msg: Add a new <form:rewrite> tag, inspired by the encodeURL tag submitted by
Pierre Metras.  This tag generates a request URI, possibly encoded with
the session identifier if needed, following exactly the same rules that
the <form:link> tag uses to generate the request URI for a hyperlink.

author: craigmcc
msg: Sigh ... the XHTML spec says use both "lang" and "xml:lang" but this would
Now, there is an "xhtml" attribute on the <form:html> tag that you must
set to true in order to generate the xml:lang attribute.
